de.coderarea.jrdp.protocol.ASN1

Class BitInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • de.coderarea.jrdp.protocol.ASN1.BitInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class BitInputStream
extends InputStream
    InputStream that allows bit-wise reading from an underlying byte-source.
    Author:
    Sascha Biedermann

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitInputStream(byte[] data)
      Creates a new stream from an existing byte[] array.
      BitInputStream(InputStream stream)
      Encapsulates an existing InputStream.

      int readBit()
      Reads one bit from the stream.
      int readBit(int n)
      Reads up to 32 bits from the stream.
      int skipPadding()
      Reads and discards bits until the stream becomes byte-aligned.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read()
         throws IOException
        Reads one byte from the stream.
        The byte read is not necessarily byte-aligned to the underlying source.
        Specified by:
        read in class InputStream
        Returns:
        byte read
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readBit

            throws IOException

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • readBit

        public int readBit(int n)
            throws IOException
        Reads up to 32 bits from the stream.
        Parameters:
        n - number of bits to be read. 1..32
        Returns:
        bits read
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - thrown when n is out of bounds
        IOException

      • skipPadding

        public int skipPadding()
        Reads and discards bits until the stream becomes byte-aligned.
        If the stream is already byte-aligned then nothing happens - no bits are discarded. At least 0 and at most 7 bits are discarded.
        Returns:
        number of bits discarded
